Name: George Madeley
Description: As a passionate software developer, I delve into the realms of full-stack web development, machine learning, and game development. Youâ€™ll often find me immersed in learning new programming languages, meticulously documenting code, or contributing to exciting new projects.

Name: Tabitha Hirst
Description: I am a second year Computer Systems student and I love both hardware and software. I also enjoy product design and film. Hopefully I'll be back in 2025 after my placement year!

Name: Melissa Mitchell
Description: I am a third year PhD student in Electronic and Electrical Engineering, with an MSc in Radiation Biology and a BSc in Physics. I joined the team in 2022 and now lead the technical groups and act as a consultant where possible.

Name: Daniel Light
Description: Possesses experience in programming, circuit design, and finance management. As Head of Finance, created a finance spreadsheet for the team, implemented an autonomous notification system to aid future cohorts in finding and applying for grants, and supported team members throughout the course of the year.

Name: Alexz Farrall
Description: I am a Research Engineer specialising in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) within the field of Computer Science, with a robust background in Electronics and Communication Engineering. My expertise lies in developing innovative healthcare solutions that integrate Artificial Intelligence, Biofeedback, and Shape-changing Technologies. Beyond my primary focus, I've contributed to advancing optical transmission technologies in biomedical devices and spearheaded transformative strategies for phosphate retrieval and the release of GMOs in water treatment and fertilisation processes. I am the founder of the Bidevice Without Borders Team, an initiative dedicated to leveraging technology for global health improvements.

Name: Jamie Diamand
Description: I'm from Brighton, I enjoy playing piano and looking after my cat. Within my team I am retrieving, organising, and processing the data we are given by our sensors.

Name: Tom Henderson
Description: Hi I'm Tom, I'm a first year student who loves to read, play all sorts of sports and create things! When home I enjoy spending time with my two dogs and travelling with friends. Glad to be a member of BWB.

Name: Jordan Dawson
Description: One of the founding members and current Head of Sensors for Biodevices Without Borders. Led development on all the sensors currently under development with a focus on pH sensors.

Name: Harry Kneale Roby
Description: I am a hardware engineer for TBBwB, I specialise in RTL hardware design for FPGAs and embedded development.

Name: Vrinda Raninga
Description: I am a 3rd year student studying Chemical Engineering who has been a part of Bath Biodevices without Borders (and its iterations) since my first year. I have thoroughly enjoyed watching the team grow to what it is today and am excited for it to continue when I leave too.

Name: Alexa Mesham
Description: I am a third year chemical engineering student and have been a member of the team since my second year. As a South African, this project is close to my heart and I have loved playing a part in its progress.

Name: Olivia Smith
Description: I'm a biology student who enjoys microbiology, climbing, occasionally running and trying to make sense of what these engineers say in the weekly meetings.

Name: Anjleen Devgun
Description: I am a second year EEE student who is interested in a career in cyber security.

Name: Helena Woodvine
Description: Being a highly motivated and inquisitive individual I am hugely enjoying contributing towards Biodevices without Borders' applied learning project. Eager to pursue a Biotechnology-orientated career addressing UN STGs, aiding in the development and testing of electrochemical sensors for different water safety parameters is incredibly insightful. Further fuelling my interest in diagnostic lab-on-chip biosensing technology, I'm integrated across teams to have a comprehensive understanding of the processes involved to allow the development of these devices.
